page.title: 02Cheshunt News June 28 1985
page.content: A lucky 13 year old race horse from Cheshunt goes to Wembley on October 11 for the final of the Lloyds Bank In Hand championships. Last Thursday the Primary District Sports was held at Turnford School. 14 local schools took part. St Josephs School came first. Tesco has scooped three awards in the 1985 supermarket quality food competition. An unusual rescue mission faced Firemen in Cheshunt on Sunday. A woman had to have two rings cut off her fingers after trapping them in a car door. A team from Cheshunt Rugby Football club took part in the gruelling Three Peaks Race and raised over 2000 pounds for the British Red Cross. First year of Turnford School are making history over Domesday Project.
